All prices are VAT exclusive

Ready for the communication of the future?

You want to migrate your existing ISDN line to the newest technology? Discover Call Connect and Multiline and contact us. We will be at your side to guide you during the migration!

  * „Äê31‚Ä†Discover the future of IP telephony (.pdf) New window„Äë

## More advantages in a Pack

Bizz Call Connect is only available in a Business pack

Recommended 

### Already have a Business pack? 

Bizz Call Connect

The phone line in the cloud

  * Unlimited calls 24/7 to all fixed lines in Belgium
  * 1000 minutes to Mobile in Belgium
  * All the functionalities of a classic phone exchange
  * You pay a fixed amount every month per user
  * Reachable via 1 number on your fixed line, smartphone or voicemail

‚Ç¨25 /month for 2 users  
(in a Business Flex)

„Äê32‚Ä†Discover the offer„Äë

„Äê32‚Ä†More details „Äë 

### Already have a telephone exchange? 

Multi Line

The phone line in the cloud

  * Multi Line is a multi-user solution utilizing a physical telephone switchboard.
  * It operates on IP technology and includes the 'Unlimited Calls National/International' rate plan, enabling unlimited landline and mobile calling: 
    * unlimited calls from landline to landlines in Belgium
    * 1000 minutes/month from landline to mobile numbers in Belgium
    * 1000 minutes/month from landline to: 
      * landlines and mobile numbers in Europe, Canada, and the USA
      * landlines in Morocco and Turkey

‚Ç¨25 /month for 2 users  
(in a Business Flex)

„Äê33‚Ä†Order now„Äë

## Phone Line over IP

### Your caller never sounded so clear

  * „Äê34‚Ä† HD quality „Äë 
  * „Äê35‚Ä† Hear the difference yourself „Äë 
  * „Äê36‚Ä† Questions? „Äë 

#### Excellent digital sound quality

Phone Line over IP technology is now included as standard in all new Business Flex packs. In practice, this mean that everyone who opts for a new Business Flex can make calls on a HD phone with excellent digital sound quality.

„Äê37‚Ä†Compose your Business Flex „Äë

You already have a pack with Phone Line and you also want to benefit from this excellent sound quaility? Then call our customer service on 0800 55 500 or visit a „Äê38‚Ä†Proximus Shop„Äë to switch of charge to Phone Line over IP.

#### Listen and experience the difference yourself

How does it work?

Your calls go through your modem instead of the traditional voice channel. Since voices are first digitized by the HD phone, they‚Äôre transmitted almost undistorted. So, ideally, all callers should have a HD phone to get the most out of the quality.

Do call rates remain the same?

Calls in digital quality don't cost more than normal calls. The standard Phone Line rates remain applicable. And the HD phone itself is not expensive: you can get one for just ‚Ç¨49.58 (VAT excl.).

Do you already have a pack with Phone Line?

Do you want to benefit from this excellent sound quality on your fixed phone? Then call our customer service on 0800 55 800 or visit a Proximus Shop to switch free of charge to Phone Line over IP. A Proximus technician will come by to install this technology (and, if necessary, a more recent modem) free of charge. Your can still use your current phone but to make calls in HD you will, of course, need a HD phone.

Does my communications over IP technology have an impact on my internet volume?

No. A call with IP technology has no impact on the internet volume.

I have an alarm, fax or other analog device. Is it compatible with Phone Line over IP?

If you don't have a telephone exchange, these devices can be directly connected to the "b-box 3V+" modem (2 ports possible).

For an alarm that uses the landline as a communication channel, we recommend you equip the line with a UPS battery (battery backup b-box 3V+) to prevent power cuts.

Old analog phones don't need any power. Does this also apply to devices with Phone Line over IP? What if there‚Äôs an electricity cut?

Phone Line over IP phones have to be connected to the electricity grid. To guarantee the functioning of devices for which continuity of voice and data connection is crucial (alarms, surveillance lines, etc.), we recommend you equip your modem with a battery (battery backup b-box 3V+). This battery ensures Phone Line over IP continues to work by providing one hour of electricity on a "b-box 3V+" modem and an optical-fiber modem (OLT: Optical Line Termination). To guarantee the functioning of your telephone exchange, we also recommend you opt for a UPS battery (Uninterruptable Power Supply).

What if IP is not available in my region? What are the alternatives?

In the rare cases where there no DSL access or optical fiber is available (less than 5% of Belgian territory), Proximus will continue to provide a traditional PSTN telephone service in the years to come.

## Even more advantageous in a Pack!

Choose for a pack Business Flex and call unlimited to all mobile and fixed numbers in Belgium.

„Äê37‚Ä† Choose your Business Flex „Äë 

[Image 4] 

## Recommended for you

### Paying options

Optimize your landline to it‚Äôs full potential with our paying services.

Besides a junction box and a terminal (telephone, fax, etc.), the installation only requires a connection to the Proximus network.  
However, you do need the following Proximus infrastructure:

  * a lead-in cable that enters your building from the public domain
  * a connection point that terminates the Proximus infrastructure inside your building

If you do not have the appropriate infrastructure, please call our „Äê14‚Ä†Customer Service‚Ä†www.proximus.be„Äë in order to take the preliminary steps.

Your appointment will be confirmed by SMS and by telephone

We work hard to continuously improve our service. To make sure that our appointments for installations and repairs can proceed smoothly, all appointments are confirmed by SMS. Moreover, our technician will call you about 30 minutes before arriving at your premises.

The installation charges of ‚Ç¨114.05 include:

  * Activation charge: ‚Ç¨48.76
  * Fixed call-out charge: ‚Ç¨40.50
  * Installation of junction box: ‚Ç¨24.79

### Why keep a fixed line for your business?

Telephony and a fixed line are still very much alive and well in professional circles, and this for many reasons:

  * Hearing quality and comfort
  * The fixed line proves that your company has established premises
  * The fixed line gets you mentioned in the telephone directories

## Phone Line over IP

### Your caller never sounded so clear

  * „Äê34‚Ä† HD quality „Äë 
  * „Äê35‚Ä† Hear the difference yourself „Äë 
  * „Äê36‚Ä† Questions? „Äë 

#### Excellent digital sound quality

Phone Line over IP technology is now included as standard in all new Business Flex packs. In practice, this mean that everyone who opts for a new Business Flex can make calls on a HD phone with excellent digital sound quality.

„Äê37‚Ä†Compose your Business Flex „Äë

You already have a pack with Phone Line and you also want to benefit from this excellent sound quaility? Then call our customer service on 0800 55 500 or visit a „Äê38‚Ä†Proximus Shop„Äë to switch of charge to Phone Line over IP.

#### Listen and experience the difference yourself

How does it work?

Your calls go through your modem instead of the traditional voice channel. Since voices are first digitized by the HD phone, they‚Äôre transmitted almost undistorted. So, ideally, all callers should have a HD phone to get the most out of the quality.

Do call rates remain the same?

Calls in digital quality don't cost more than normal calls. The standard Phone Line rates remain applicable. And the HD phone itself is not expensive: you can get one for just ‚Ç¨49.58 (VAT excl.).

Do you already have a pack with Phone Line?

Do you want to benefit from this excellent sound quality on your fixed phone? Then call our customer service on 0800 55 800 or visit a Proximus Shop to switch free of charge to Phone Line over IP. A Proximus technician will come by to install this technology (and, if necessary, a more recent modem) free of charge. Your can still use your current phone but to make calls in HD you will, of course, need a HD phone.

Does my communications over IP technology have an impact on my internet volume?

No. A call with IP technology has no impact on the internet volume.

I have an alarm, fax or other analog device. Is it compatible with Phone Line over IP?

If you don't have a telephone exchange, these devices can be directly connected to the "b-box 3V+" modem (2 ports possible).

For an alarm that uses the landline as a communication channel, we recommend you equip the line with a UPS battery (battery backup b-box 3V+) to prevent power cuts.

Old analog phones don't need any power. Does this also apply to devices with Phone Line over IP? What if there‚Äôs an electricity cut?

Phone Line over IP phones have to be connected to the electricity grid. To guarantee the functioning of devices for which continuity of voice and data connection is crucial (alarms, surveillance lines, etc.), we recommend you equip your modem with a battery (battery backup b-box 3V+). This battery ensures Phone Line over IP continues to work by providing one hour of electricity on a "b-box 3V+" modem and an optical-fiber modem (OLT: Optical Line Termination). To guarantee the functioning of your telephone exchange, we also recommend you opt for a UPS battery (Uninterruptable Power Supply).

What if IP is not available in my region? What are the alternatives?

In the rare cases where there no DSL access or optical fiber is available (less than 5% of Belgian territory), Proximus will continue to provide a traditional PSTN telephone service in the years to come.

Choose for a pack Business Flex and call unlimited to all mobile and fixed numbers in Belgium.

## The smart system for handling your business calls

#### With Bizz Call Connect, you won't miss any call

  * From your employees' landlines and mobile devices
  * Access all the functionalities of a telephone exchange

#### How does Bizz Call Connect work?

 See more See less

#### How does Bizz Call Connect work?

An example: Peter and Mary are architects and share the same office.

They have a general number which they give out to their customers and use in their communication (business card, website, advertising, etc.). If a customer dials this number, the call will simultaneously arrive on both Peter and Mary‚Äôs landline. If they are on a construction site, the call will be diverted to their mobile phone.

On the construction site when Mary and Peter call a customer from their mobile, it's the landline number that will be displayed. In this way, their mobile phone numbers remain private.

On Tuesdays, Mary is always in the office.

To avoid disturbing Peter, all calls arrive on Mary's landline phone only.

Outside office hours, a welcome message is played back to customers. They can leave any messages on an answering machine.

[Image 7]

Bizz Call Connect

As from ‚Ç¨25 /month + free installation

„Äê31‚Ä†Request a quote„Äë 

## How does the installation work?

### Free installation

A technician will call in at no charge to install the Bizz Call Connect solution and the associated equipment. He will take care of the basic setup and help you familiarize with the phones, the app and the portal.

[Image 8] 

#### Limit your investments and rent IP phones

You don't have to invest in hardware. You can rent IP phones from Proximus.

„Äê32‚Ä† Discover the phones Opens a new window „Äë

A Proximus VDSL2 Internet line is required to use Bizz Call Connect.  
*Unlimited national calls with Business Flex : *Unlimited national calls to landline numbers and 1,000 minutes per month to mobile numbers, valid from one fixed number.  
If you call for more than 1,000 minutes, you pay a special rate. Calls 24/7, except to special numbers (voting, 0900, etc.).  
*Unlimited international calls: from your landline, 1,000 minutes for calling landline and mobile numbers in 37 countries (Andorra, Bulgaria, Canada, Cyprus, Denmark, Germany, Estonia, Faroe Islands, Finland, France, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Croatia, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Monaco, Netherlands, Norway, Austria, Poland, Portugal, Romania, San Marino, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Czech Republic, United Kingdom, United States, Sweden, and Switzerland). Only to landline numbers in Morocco and Turkey. If you exceed the 1,000 minutes or call other countries, you pay a special rate of -50% instead of the standard rate (Classic).

If you opt for a Business Flex plan, the ¬´ Bizz Switch ¬ª product is automatically removed from your pack as all its features are included in Bizz Call Connect. When a Bizz Call Connect solution or Multi Line is added to ¬† Business Flex , the included traditional telephone line (PSTN) will be automatically replaced by an IP line. NB: some alarms are not compatible with the IP line. Please contact your vendor for more information.

Promo Free installation (instead of ‚Ç¨ 350) valid from 01 July 2019 to 31 December 2024 for the installation and configuration costs of the licenses and for travel costs, but does not include the cost of installing options, extra indoor cabling, any specific on-site work required, and the cost of installing the lines and Internet.

With the Webex app, you can not only handle your landline calls on your smartphone, but also improve your workflows and stay connected thanks to a complete suite of team collaboration features (calls, voicemail, meetings and integration).

#### How does Bizz Call Connect work?

 See more See less

#### How does Bizz Call Connect work?

An example: Peter and Mary are architects and share the same office.

They have a general number which they give out to their customers and use in their communication (business card, website, advertising, etc.). If a customer dials this number, the call will simultaneously arrive on both Peter and Mary‚Äôs landline. If they are on a construction site, the call will be diverted to their mobile phone.

On the construction site when Mary and Peter call a customer from their mobile, it's the landline number that will be displayed. In this way, their mobile phone numbers remain private.

On Tuesdays, Mary is always in the office.

To avoid disturbing Peter, all calls arrive on Mary's landline phone only.

Outside office hours, a welcome message is played back to customers. They can leave any messages on an answering machine.

## Phone Line over IP

### Your caller never sounded so clear

  * „Äê34‚Ä† HD quality „Äë 
  * „Äê35‚Ä† Hear the difference yourself „Äë 
  * „Äê36‚Ä† Questions? „Äë 

#### Excellent digital sound quality

Phone Line over IP technology is now included as standard in all new Business Flex packs. In practice, this mean that everyone who opts for a new Business Flex can make calls on a HD phone with excellent digital sound quality.

„Äê37‚Ä†Compose your Business Flex „Äë

You already have a pack with Phone Line and you also want to benefit from this excellent sound quaility? Then call our customer service on 0800 55 500 or visit a „Äê38‚Ä†Proximus Shop„Äë to switch of charge to Phone Line over IP.

#### Listen and experience the difference yourself

How does it work?

Your calls go through your modem instead of the traditional voice channel. Since voices are first digitized by the HD phone, they‚Äôre transmitted almost undistorted. So, ideally, all callers should have a HD phone to get the most out of the quality.

Do call rates remain the same?

Calls in digital quality don't cost more than normal calls. The standard Phone Line rates remain applicable. And the HD phone itself is not expensive: you can get one for just ‚Ç¨49.58 (VAT excl.).

Do you already have a pack with Phone Line?

Do you want to benefit from this excellent sound quality on your fixed phone? Then call our customer service on 0800 55 800 or visit a Proximus Shop to switch free of charge to Phone Line over IP. A Proximus technician will come by to install this technology (and, if necessary, a more recent modem) free of charge. Your can still use your current phone but to make calls in HD you will, of course, need a HD phone.

Does my communications over IP technology have an impact on my internet volume?

No. A call with IP technology has no impact on the internet volume.

I have an alarm, fax or other analog device. Is it compatible with Phone Line over IP?

If you don't have a telephone exchange, these devices can be directly connected to the "b-box 3V+" modem (2 ports possible).

For an alarm that uses the landline as a communication channel, we recommend you equip the line with a UPS battery (battery backup b-box 3V+) to prevent power cuts.

Old analog phones don't need any power. Does this also apply to devices with Phone Line over IP? What if there‚Äôs an electricity cut?

Phone Line over IP phones have to be connected to the electricity grid. To guarantee the functioning of devices for which continuity of voice and data connection is crucial (alarms, surveillance lines, etc.), we recommend you equip your modem with a battery (battery backup b-box 3V+). This battery ensures Phone Line over IP continues to work by providing one hour of electricity on a "b-box 3V+" modem and an optical-fiber modem (OLT: Optical Line Termination). To guarantee the functioning of your telephone exchange, we also recommend you opt for a UPS battery (Uninterruptable Power Supply).

What if IP is not available in my region? What are the alternatives?

In the rare cases where there no DSL access or optical fiber is available (less than 5% of Belgian territory), Proximus will continue to provide a traditional PSTN telephone service in the years to come.

## Even more advantageous in a Pack!

Choose for a pack Business Flex and call unlimited to all mobile and fixed numbers in Belgium.

„Äê37‚Ä† Choose your Business Flex „Äë

   - Cr√©e un **groupe d'appel** pour que les appels puissent √™tre dirig√©s vers plusieurs extensions simultan√©ment (par exemple, ta coll√®gue et Miriam).
   - Si les appels doivent √™tre redirig√©s apr√®s un certain d√©lai, configure une **file d'attente** pour permettre √† ta coll√®gue de distribuer les appels lorsqu'elle est disponible.

### 6. **Messagerie vocale et redirection en dehors des heures d'ouverture**
   - Configure un message de bienvenue et la messagerie vocale via l'interface de **gestion des appels**.
   - Cr√©e des r√®gles d‚Äôhoraires pour que les appels en dehors des heures de bureau soient redirig√©s vers une messagerie ou une autre extension.

### 7. **Acc√®s mobile pour des transferts d'appels**
   - Assure-toi que les employ√©s, y compris ta coll√®gue, ont l‚Äôapplication **3CX Mobile** install√©e sur leur t√©l√©phone pour g√©rer les appels m√™me lorsqu‚Äôils ne sont pas au bureau.

Si tu veux des configurations sp√©cifiques pour des fonctions plus avanc√©es, n‚Äôh√©site pas √† me le dire, et je te guiderai plus en d√©tail pour chaque √©tape.

#### How does Bizz Call Connect work?

An example: Peter and Mary are architects and share the same office.

They have a general number which they give out to their customers and use in their communication (business card, website, advertising, etc.). If a customer dials this number, the call will simultaneously arrive on both Peter and Mary‚Äôs landline. If they are on a construction site, the call will be diverted to their mobile phone.

On the construction site when Mary and Peter call a customer from their mobile, it's the landline number that will be displayed. In this way, their mobile phone numbers remain private.

On Tuesdays, Mary is always in the office.

To avoid disturbing Peter, all calls arrive on Mary's landline phone only.

Outside office hours, a welcome message is played back to customers. They can leave any messages on an answering machine.

Only to landline numbers in Morocco and Turkey. If you exceed the 1,000 minutes or call other countries, you pay a special rate of -50% instead of the standard rate (Classic).

parts: Mais donc, th√©oriquement je n'aurai pas besoin de demander √† Proximus un trunk SIP si le num√©ro central est le num√©ro de GSM de Miriam ?! Si ?

En th√©orie, **non**, tu n'aurais pas besoin de demander un trunk SIP √† Proximus si le num√©ro central que tu utilises pour g√©rer les appels est un num√©ro de GSM, comme celui de **Miriam**. Un trunk SIP est principalement requis lorsque tu veux g√©rer des **lignes fixes** ou si tu as plusieurs **num√©ros virtuels** qui doivent √™tre reli√©s √† ton syst√®me 3CX via une connexion internet pour passer des appels.

Dans ton cas, si le num√©ro central est d√©j√† un **num√©ro GSM**, tu peux tout simplement configurer **3CX** pour rediriger les appels entrants vers ce num√©ro via l‚Äôapplication mobile 3CX, qui peut g√©rer les appels en utilisant ce num√©ro sans passer par un trunk SIP. Cela simplifie la configuration, car tu utilises un **num√©ro mobile existant** et non un service VoIP ou une ligne fixe.

Voici comment cela fonctionne :
- Les appels entrants sur le num√©ro GSM peuvent √™tre g√©r√©s via le syst√®me 3CX (softphone ou application mobile).
- **Pas besoin de SIP trunk** si tout le flux d'appels se fait via le r√©seau mobile de Proximus.
- Si tu veux passer par un trunk SIP √† l'avenir (pour des fonctionnalit√©s plus avanc√©es ou des num√©ros suppl√©mentaires), tu pourrais envisager d'ajouter cette fonctionnalit√©.

Donc, √† moins que tu ne veuilles des fonctionnalit√©s sp√©cifiques li√©es √† une ligne fixe ou √† une architecture IP compl√®te, ton **num√©ro GSM** de Miriam devrait suffire pour g√©rer tout via 3CX.
C'est quoi un SDA stp ?

Un **SDA** (S√©lection Directe √† l'Arriv√©e) est un num√©ro de t√©l√©phone qui permet de diriger directement un appel vers une extension ou un poste sp√©cifique dans un syst√®me de t√©l√©phonie d'entreprise, sans passer par un standard ou un op√©rateur. En anglais, cela correspond √† **DID** (Direct Inward Dialing).

Cela signifie que chaque employ√© ou service peut avoir un num√©ro unique, tout en √©tant connect√© √† une m√™me ligne principale ou un m√™me PBX (Private Branch Exchange). Par exemple, un client peut appeler directement une personne ou un d√©partement sp√©cifique sans devoir passer par un num√©ro g√©n√©ral.

Le SDA est souvent utilis√© dans les entreprises qui ont besoin de plusieurs lignes directes pour diff√©rents employ√©s ou services, tout en utilisant une seule ligne t√©l√©phonique centrale ou un PBX. 

Si tu utilises un syst√®me comme 3CX, tu pourrais th√©oriquement attribuer des SDA √† tes employ√©s ou coll√®gues, si tu as plusieurs num√©ros, pour qu'ils puissent √™tre joints directement.
Mais donc si je comprends je dois mettre le num√©ro de GSM comme SDA ?

Non, tu n'as pas besoin de configurer ton num√©ro GSM comme un **SDA** dans ton syst√®me 3CX, car le SDA (ou DID en anglais) est g√©n√©ralement utilis√© pour des **num√©ros fixes** ou des **num√©ros virtuels** connect√©s √† un syst√®me PBX via un trunk SIP.

Dans ton cas, si le **num√©ro central** de ton asbl est d√©j√† un **num√©ro GSM**, tu n'as pas besoin d'un SDA suppl√©mentaire pour acheminer les appels vers les diff√©rents collaborateurs, car les appels GSM sont d√©j√† directement associ√©s √† ce num√©ro.

Voici la distinction :
- Un **SDA** est surtout utile si tu as un **trunk SIP** ou plusieurs lignes fixes, car il te permet d'acheminer un appel vers une extension ou un poste sp√©cifique dans ton syst√®me PBX.
- Si tu utilises un **num√©ro GSM** comme num√©ro principal pour recevoir les appels, tu n'as pas besoin d'un SDA. Tu configurerais simplement ton syst√®me 3CX pour rediriger ou transf√©rer les appels entrants √† partir de ce num√©ro GSM vers les bonnes extensions (comme le softphone de ta coll√®gue, par exemple).

Donc, dans ton cas, tu peux continuer √† utiliser le num√©ro GSM de Miriam sans ajouter de SDA. Le syst√®me 3CX te permet ensuite de g√©rer la r√©partition des appels entrants vers les diff√©rentes personnes ou extensions.
Et pour regler la repartition des appels qui arrive sur ce num√©ro de gsm je dois faire √ßa o√π ? Dans l'interface d'administration ou sur le smartphone de Miriam dans l'application 3CX ?

Pour g√©rer la r√©partition des appels qui arrivent sur le num√©ro GSM de Miriam dans **3CX**, la configuration principale se fait dans **l'interface d'administration** de 3CX, plut√¥t que sur son smartphone.

Voici les √©tapes pour g√©rer cette r√©partition :

### 1. **Interface d‚Äôadministration de 3CX** :
   - **Acc√©der √† la console d‚Äôadministration** de 3CX via ton navigateur.
   - Dans le menu √† gauche, va dans la section **‚ÄúInbound Rules‚Äù** (r√®gles des appels entrants).
   - Ici, tu pourras configurer les **r√®gles d‚Äôacheminement des appels** entrants vers le num√©ro GSM de Miriam. Par exemple, tu peux :
     - **Rediriger les appels** vers une extension sp√©cifique (comme le softphone de Miriam).
     - **Transf√©rer les appels** vers un autre employ√© apr√®s un certain d√©lai ou en cas d'absence.
     - Configurer une **file d'attente** ou un **groupe d'appels** si plusieurs personnes doivent pouvoir r√©pondre aux appels.

### 2. **Application 3CX sur le smartphone** :
   - Miriam peut utiliser l‚Äôapplication **3CX Mobile** pour g√©rer ses appels, mais la **r√©partition automatique** des appels entrants doit √™tre d√©finie dans l'interface d'administration.
   - L'application permet de recevoir les appels, de les transf√©rer manuellement ou de configurer des options comme la **disponibilit√©** (en ligne, occup√©e, etc.), mais la configuration des r√®gles de transfert automatiques doit passer par la console admin.

> „Äê68‚Ä†hb1_ said:„Äë 
> 
> So using one of these, say the HT801 from grandstream, will help assign my local landline to the 3cx system? So customers can call on the number assigned from my provider? 
> 
> Click to expand...

Correct  

remember you can only have one call at one time , either incoming or outgoing   

If you want to handle more external calls, you may wish to look a sip providers

  * „Äê69‚Ä† Jul 24, 2021 „Äë 

  * „Äê69‚Ä† „Äë 
  * „Äê69‚Ä† #5 „Äë 

If there is even a chance, that you will add an additional PSTN line, in the future, it may be worthwhile to consider a multi-line gateway.   

If you find the need to place outgoing calls, when the PSTN line is engaged, you could add a SIP provider, just for outgoing. Many will allow you to send the same caller ID used by your your PSTN line so people will call back, on your existing line. This can usually be done with no monthly charge, just a very low cost for the time used. In the future, you might also consider porting over the PSTN number, to that same provider, once you become comfortable with VoIP.

> „Äê68‚Ä†hb1_ said:„Äë 
> 
> So using one of these, say the HT801 from grandstream, will help assign my local landline to the 3cx system? So customers can call on the number assigned from my provider? 
> 
> Click to expand...

The HT801 is for connecting an analog phone or fax machine as an extension.   

You would want something like the Grandstream GXW4104 to connect a landline/PSTN phone line to 3CX.

Hi „Äê81‚Ä†hb1_„Äë,  

You can choose any of the below supported FXO gateways to connect the PSTN lines.  

„Äê82‚Ä†https://www.3cx.com/voip-gateways/grandstream-fxo/„Äë  
„Äê83‚Ä†https://www.3cx.com/voip-gateways/patton-smartnode-sn4112/„Äë   
„Äê84‚Ä†https://www.3cx.com/voip-gateways/beronet-berofix-400/„Äë  

4 Port FXO Gateway- Available in all 3 brands.  
2 Port FXO Gateway - Available in Patton.  

Select the gateway model based on your budget and the future expansion of the PSTN trunk.

content.text:
The 3CX Enterprise plan includes all Professional plan features plus:

  * Voice Calling Features: Skills-based routing, pause-resume call recording, inbuilt failover, custom IP phone logo, standby license
  * Video Conferencing Features: Up to 250 video meeting participants
  * Third-Party Integrations: Microsoft Teams

## 3CX Phone System Top Features

3CX offers an impressive array of features across all plans, including voice and video calling, business SMS, website chat, team collaboration tools, and analytics. Below, we provide a quick overview of 3CX‚Äôs best features, which include call routing, ring groups, real-time reports, call flow design, and more.

### Call Switchboard

All paid 3CX plans include the call switchboard feature, which is an end-user dashboard for streamlined, one-click call management.

[Image 4: 3cx switchboard]

The switchboard displays real-time agent status, enables drag-and-drop call transfers (warm/blind), and lets users upgrade voice calls to an audio conference or video call. Within the switchboard, users can also send chat or text messages, record calls, leave voicemails, park calls, and place callers on hold.

Different switchboard views are available for agents, receptionists, admins, and managers.¬† Only managers have access to call monitoring, call barge, and call whisper capabilities, as well as live call queue monitoring via 3CX wallboards.

### Basic Voice Calling Features

[Image 5: 3cx business hour routing]

3CX offers numerous voice calling and call management features, including:

  * Interactive Voice Response (IVR): All paid 3CX plans include auto attendants and „Äê15‚Ä†multi-level IVR„Äë. Admins can upload pre-recorded call menus to direct inbound calls without involving a live agent. Each IVR menu can have up to 10 sub-menus that route callers to the best available call queue , extension, agent, or ring group.
  * Call Routing and Business Hour Rules: Paid 3CX plans include custom business hour routing rules that follow preset call paths during business hours, but forward calls to external numbers or voicemail boxes after office hours. The Small Business plan includes simultaneous call blasting and numerous „Äê44‚Ä†call routing strategies„Äë, including round robin, list-based, random, most idle, fewest answered calls, and lowest talk time routing. Custom routing strategies are also available. „Äê45‚Ä†Skills-based routing„Äë is limited to the Professional and Enterprise plans.
  * Ring Groups and Call Queues: Admins can create ring groups of multiple agents with similar skill sets, schedules, or other criteria. Calls can be routed to these ring groups instead of individual agents, increasing the likelihood of an answer. Callers are sent to wait in customizable call queues if no agents are available. Enterprise users can access advanced call queue features like built-in post-call wrap-up time, call queue maximums, call queue email notifications, and priority queues.
  * Call Flow Designer: Enterprise and Professional 3CX plans include the self-managed call flow designer for more advanced IVR and call distribution. Users can also collect customer payments via phone, customize outbound dialing rules, access power dialing, specifically the amount of time between outbound calls, and create customer surveys.
  * Voicemail: All 3CX plans include voicemail messaging with a custom greeting, voicemail-to-email, real-time voicemail push notifications, and one-click callbacks. Voicemail transcription is available only to Professional and Enterprise users.
  * Call Recording: All 3CX paid plans include manual (on-demand) call recording, with pause-resume recording restricted to Enterprise plan holders. Searchable local and cloud recording storage is included. Recording transcription is only available via a paid OpenAI integration, which users must configure themselves.
  * Customer Callback: Instead of requiring customers to wait on hold, admins can enable „Äê46‚Ä†customer callbacks„Äë to let customers schedule a time to receive a callback from an available agent.

### Business Messaging

3CX provides excellent business messaging features, enabling internal and external communication via live website chat, Facebook Messenger, WhatsApp, SMS, and instant team chat messaging.

[Image 6: 3cx website chat]

All messaging interactions, regardless of channel, are streamlined into a single inbox to avoid communication silos, with icons to identify the current messaging channel.

Agents can chat with website visitors to make product recommendations, provide customer support, and increase conversions. Admins can design chat queues to connect customers to the best available agent and create automatic message response templates with custom triggers. Team members can transfer live chats, share files and images with customers, mark chats as resolved, view chat interaction history, and create contacts from chat messages.

While agents can access individual and group team chat messaging and file sharing, 3CX lacks advanced team chat features like message threading, replies, and user mentions.

### Video Conferencing

All 3CX plans include unlimited HD video conferencing for desktop and mobile devices alongside in-meeting collaboration tools. The Free and Small Business plans limit meeting participants to 25, the Professional plan allows for 100 participants, and the Enterprise plan has a 250-participant cap.

[Image 7: 3cx video calling]

3CX video conferencing is browser-based, doesn‚Äôt store personal data, and doesn‚Äôt require users to download an app or create an account to join a video call. Meetings can be scheduled or on-demand, and hosts can share meeting links via a link, chat, email, WhatsApp, or QR code. Video conferences can be livestreamed to YouTube or screencast to Chromecast-enabled devices. Meeting lengths are unlimited, with up to 16 simultaneous screens and 50 simultaneous audio-only screens.

Personalized 3CX meeting links can be added to a business website, email signature, or social media account to enable instant video meetings with customers and other external users. Users can run audio and video tests before a meeting, blur their backgrounds, set meeting layouts, enable echo cancellation, and adjust participant video and audio controls.

In-meeting collaboration features include:

  * Team chat with Q&A
  * Screen sharing and remote control
  * File and PDF sharing and annotations
  * Virtual hand-raising, and polls
  * Whiteboards with drawing tools and templates

### Reporting and Analytics

All 3CX plans come with basic call logs and chat reports, but more advanced historical and live analytics are restricted to paid plans.

3CX lets managers review chat queue volumes, chat abandonment rate, chat channel popularity (website chat, SMS, Facebook, WhatsApp), and the number of chats individual agents handled over a custom date range. Users can integrate Google Analytics for more advanced chat and website interaction monitoring.

[Image 8: 3cx wallboards]

Live call center monitoring is available via the 3CX wallboard, shown in the above image. Users can review real-time call queue statistics, average wait a

## Act big‚Ä¶ even when you‚Äôre small

[Image 1]

### A business number

Stop giving your personal number out for business purposes. Split social and business - contacts and hours - with 3CX SOHO Free.

[Image 2]

### No missed calls

You‚Äôre busy and can‚Äôt pick up? No problem. Don‚Äôt leave the phone ringing and your customer hanging. Route your calls.

„Äê17‚Ä†WhatsApp & Text„Äë

Designed for more than just calls. Start managing inbound WhatsApp and text messages from one central place with the whole team helping.

„Äê8‚Ä†Live Chat„Äë

Use the free website chat feature to convert website visitors and to re-engage with customers. Easy to install - perfect to use.

„Äê57‚Ä†Click2Call„Äë

Let customers click on a number to launch a call right from your web page. You‚Äôll stay in your workspace to collect the call without having to switch apps or devices.

„Äê12‚Ä†Remote working„Äë

Best in class iOS, Android, Windows or Web apps let you stay connected, using your office number, no matter where you and your team are.

„Äê58‚Ä†Video conferencing „Äë

Schedule your meetings, presentations and team catch-ups via 3CX video conferencing feature. There‚Äôs no limits or extra costs and no additional sign-ups.

„Äê59‚Ä†Low cost upgrade „Äë

3CX adapts to your changing needs, so you‚Äôre never boxed in. As your business grows, upgrade to a low cost paid 3CX Small Business plan. It‚Äôs just a few clicks away.

## Getting started is easy!

### #1 Sign up for free to be set up in no time

3CX SOHO FREE is hosted by 3CX. This makes the installation process quick and easy. „Äê21‚Ä†Sign up„Äë, install, and you‚Äôre ready. We don‚Äôt make you sign a contract. You‚Äôre free to walk away at any time.

### #2 Bring your own SIP Trunk and number

You need a SIP trunk to place calls to external numbers. You also need one to have a number on which your customers can call. 3CX puts you in the driver‚Äôs seat for this. We don‚Äôt offer bundled numbers, so there‚Äôs no hidden charges or long term contracts that are impossible to get out of. You‚Äôre free to choose from a wide range of supported VoIP providers in the „Äê60‚Ä†USA„Äë, „Äê61‚Ä†UK„Äë, „Äê62‚Ä†Australia„Äë and „Äê11‚Ä†more„Äë.

### #3 Community support

Join the „Äê23‚Ä†3CX Community„Äë. Seek advice or share opinions. While 3CX SOHO free is very easy to set up, the community is there for any additional support you might need. If you need more in depth help, 3CX is supported by a number of partners and resellers. They‚Äôre here to help, for an extra fee. „Äê9‚Ä†Find a Partner„Äë near you.

### What features are included in the SOHO FREE edition?

The SOHO Free edition is tailored for small offices with up to 10 users, providing remote working apps for iOS, Android, Windows and a Web Client. It also includes call handling options, inbound WhatsApp, Live Chat, video calls for up to 25 people and „Äê65‚Ä†more„Äë.

### How do I get a SIP Trunk if I don't have one?

It‚Äôs easy to get a SIP trunk from a VoIP Provider? Check out „Äê66‚Ä†Callcentric„Äë in the US. In the UK and Europe, try „Äê67‚Ä†Telxi‚Ä†telxi.com„Äë. For the full list check out our „Äê11‚Ä†SIP Trunk providers„Äë page.

### Do I need a 3CX phone system to use the mobile apps? 

Yes, to use our apps, you'll need a 3CX system. You've got choices: let 3CX host it for you in the cloud for a small fee or even for free. Or set it up yourself on your own server. Just know that the apps won't work unless you have a 3

„Äê12‚Ä†Remote working„Äë

Best in class iOS, Android, Windows or Web apps let you stay connected, using your office number, no matter where you and your team are.

„Äê58‚Ä†Video conferencing „Äë

Schedule your meetings, presentations and team catch-ups via 3CX video conferencing feature. There‚Äôs no limits or extra costs and no additional sign-ups.

„Äê59‚Ä†Low cost upgrade „Äë

3CX adapts to your changing needs, so you‚Äôre never boxed in. As your business grows, upgrade to a low cost paid 3CX Small Business plan. It‚Äôs just a few clicks away.

## Getting started is easy!

### #1 Sign up for free to be set up in no time

3CX SOHO FREE is hosted by 3CX. This makes the installation process quick and easy. „Äê21‚Ä†Sign up„Äë, install, and you‚Äôre ready. We don‚Äôt make you sign a contract. You‚Äôre free to walk away at any time.

### #2 Bring your own SIP Trunk and number

You need a SIP trunk to place calls to external numbers. You also need one to have a number on which your customers can call. 3CX puts you in the driver‚Äôs seat for this. We don‚Äôt offer bundled numbers, so there‚Äôs no hidden charges or long term contracts that are impossible to get out of. You‚Äôre free to choose from a wide range of supported VoIP providers in the „Äê60‚Ä†USA„Äë, „Äê61‚Ä†UK„Äë, „Äê62‚Ä†Australia„Äë and „Äê11‚Ä†more„Äë.

### #3 Community support

Join the „Äê23‚Ä†3CX Community„Äë. Seek advice or share opinions. While 3CX SOHO free is very easy to set up, the community is there for any additional support you might need. If you need more in depth help, 3CX is supported by a number of partners and resellers. They‚Äôre here to help, for an extra fee. „Äê9‚Ä†Find a Partner„Äë near you.

[Image 3: Get 3CX absolutely free!]

## 

Discover more benefits!

[Image 4: WhatsApp]

## Your questions answered...

### What features are included in the SOHO FREE edition?

The SOHO Free edition is tailored for small offices with up to 10 users, providing remote working apps for iOS, Android, Windows and a Web Client. It also includes call handling options, inbound WhatsApp, Live Chat, video calls for up to 25 people and „Äê65‚Ä†more„Äë.

### How do I get a SIP Trunk if I don't have one?

It‚Äôs easy to get a SIP trunk from a VoIP Provider? Check out „Äê66‚Ä†Callcentric„Äë in the US. In the UK and Europe, try „Äê67‚Ä†Telxi‚Ä†telxi.com„Äë. For the full list check out our „Äê11‚Ä†SIP Trunk providers„Äë page.

### Do I need a 3CX phone system to use the mobile apps? 

Yes, to use our apps, you'll need a 3CX system. You've got choices: let 3CX host it for you in the cloud for a small fee or even for free. Or set it up yourself on your own server. Just know that the apps won't work unless you have a 3

parts:
Pour utiliser la solution **3CX gratuite** pour les petites entreprises (moins de 10 utilisateurs), il est **possible** de la faire fonctionner sans avoir besoin d'un trunk SIP ni de t√©l√©phones fixes dans certaines conditions. Cependant, il y a quelques nuances √† prendre en compte :

### Fonctionnement sans SIP Trunk :
- **Pour les appels internes** au sein de l'√©quipe (via softphones ou applications mobiles), 3CX peut fonctionner **sans SIP Trunk**. Les utilisateurs peuvent passer des appels via l‚Äôapplication 3CX sur leur smartphone ou leur ordinateur. Cela convient parfaitement pour des √©quipes qui travaillent √† distance ou en t√©l√©travail.
  
- **Pour les appels externes** (vers des num√©ros de t√©l√©phones fixes ou mobiles), tu auras besoin d'un **SIP Trunk** ou d'une autre passerelle de t√©l√©phonie pour que ton syst√®me 3CX puisse se connecter au r√©seau t√©l√©phonique public (PSTN). Le plan gratuit de 3CX n'inclut pas de SIP Trunk par d√©faut, mais tu peux en configurer un via un fournisseur de VoIP compatible. Ce SIP Trunk est n√©cessaire pour √©mettre ou recevoir des appels externes via ton num√©ro central.

### Sans t√©l√©phones fixes :
- Le syst√®me 3CX est con√ßu pour √™tre utilis√© avec des **softphones** (applications sur smartphones ou ordinateurs). Tu n'as donc **pas besoin de t√©l√©phones fixes**. Toute ton √©quipe peut passer et recevoir des appels en utilisant les **applications mobiles** (iOS, Android) ou les **clients Web et Windows** de 3CX.

### Pour r√©sumer :
- **Oui**, tu peux configurer et utiliser la solution gratuite de 3CX **sans poste fixe** et pour les appels internes. Toutefois, si tu souhaites √©mettre ou recevoir des appels externes, il te faudra un **SIP Trunk**. 

Cela te permet une solution flexible, mais pour les appels externes, l'ajout d'un SIP Trunk est indispensable. Si tu cherches un fournisseur de SIP Trunk, 3CX propose une liste de partenaires compatibles„Äê45‚Ä†source„Äë„Äê46‚Ä†source„Äë„Äê48‚Ä†source„Äë.

Si tu as besoin de plus d'aide pour configurer ton syst√®me ou pour choisir un fournisseur de SIP, n'h√©site pas √† me le dire !

If there is even a chance, that you will add an additional PSTN line, in the future, it may be worthwhile to consider a multi-line gateway.   

If you find the need to place outgoing calls, when the PSTN line is engaged, you could add a SIP provider, just for outgoing. Many will allow you to send the same caller ID used by your your PSTN line so people will call back, on your existing line. This can usually be done with no monthly charge, just a very low cost for the time used. In the future, you might also consider porting over the PSTN number, to that same provider, once you become comfortable with VoIP.

## Act big‚Ä¶ even when you‚Äôre small

[Image 1]

### A business number

Stop giving your personal number out for business purposes. Split social and business - contacts and hours - with 3CX SOHO Free.

[Image 2]

### No missed calls

You‚Äôre busy and can‚Äôt pick up? No problem. Don‚Äôt leave the phone ringing and your customer hanging. Route your calls.

„Äê17‚Ä†WhatsApp & Text„Äë

Designed for more than just calls. Start managing inbound WhatsApp and text messages from one central place with the whole team helping.

„Äê8‚Ä†Live Chat„Äë

[Image 4: WhatsApp]

## Your questions answered...

### What features are included in the SOHO FREE edition?

The SOHO Free edition is tailored for small offices with up to 10 users, providing remote working apps for iOS, Android, Windows and a Web Client. It also includes call handling options, inbound WhatsApp, Live Chat, video calls for up to 25 people and „Äê65‚Ä†more„Äë.

### How do I get a SIP Trunk if I don't have one?

It‚Äôs easy to get a SIP trunk from a VoIP Provider? Check out „Äê66‚Ä†Callcentric„Äë in the US. In the UK and Europe, try „Äê67‚Ä†Telxi‚Ä†telxi.com„Äë. For the full list check out our „Äê11‚Ä†SIP Trunk providers„Äë page.

### Do I need a 3CX phone system to use the mobile apps? 

Yes, to use our apps, you'll need a 3CX system. You've got choices: let 3CX host it for you in the cloud for a small fee or even for free. Or set it up yourself on your own server. Just know that the apps won't work unless you have a 3

parts:
Haaa donc pour recevoir des appels externes aussi il faut un trunk sip ?
Qu'est-ce que c'est exactement ? Et pourquoi en faut-il un ? Si ma femme, Miriam a actuellement le num√©ro central d'appel de l'asbl dans son smartphone avec une double SIM, pourquoi l'application 3CX sur son smartphone ne dirige pas automatiquement les appels de ce num√©ro selon les r√®gles d√©finies dans la partie Traitement des appels du Dashboard 3CX ?

Pour bien comprendre pourquoi tu aurais besoin d'un **SIP Trunk** avec 3CX, il faut d'abord expliquer ce que c'est et pourquoi il est n√©cessaire dans certains cas.

### Qu'est-ce qu'un **SIP Trunk** ?
- Un **SIP Trunk** (Session Initiation Protocol Trunk) est un service qui permet √† un syst√®me de t√©l√©phonie IP (comme 3CX) de se connecter au r√©seau t√©l√©phonique public (PSTN). En gros, il s'agit d'une "passerelle" qui permet √† ton syst√®me VoIP (voix sur IP) de passer et de recevoir des appels vers/depuis des num√©ros externes (fixes ou mobiles).
- Un SIP Trunk remplace les lignes t√©l√©phoniques traditionnelles (comme les lignes analogiques ou num√©riques ISDN) et permet √† ton syst√®me PBX (Private Branch Exchange, ici 3CX) d'interagir avec le r√©seau t√©l√©phonique.

### Pourquoi est-il n√©cessaire ?
- **Pour recevoir et passer des appels externes** avec 3CX, il faut obligatoirement un **SIP Trunk** ou une solution similaire qui se connecte au r√©seau t√©l√©phonique public (PSTN). 
- Si tu utilises uniquement 3CX pour des **appels internes** (c'est-√†-dire au sein de ton organisation), tu n'as pas besoin de SIP Trunk. Mais d√®s que tu veux permettre √† quelqu'un en dehors de ton organisation d'appeler ton num√©ro principal, ou que tu souhaites appeler un num√©ro de t√©l√©phone externe, tu as besoin de cette connexion.

### Pourquoi l'application 3CX ne redirige-t-elle pas automatiquement les appels du num√©ro central de Miriam ?
- **Num√©ro mobile et SIP Trunk** : Le fait que Miriam ait le num√©ro central de l'asbl sur son smartphone via une double SIM signifie que les appels √† ce num√©ro sont g√©r√©s par son op√©rateur t√©l√©phonique (Proximus, par exemple) et non par 3CX. Pour que 3CX prenne le relais et puisse g√©rer les appels (avec ses r√®gles, redirections, files d'attente, etc.), ce num√©ro doit √™tre **rout√© via un SIP Trunk** ou un service VoIP compatible avec 3CX.
  
  Autrement dit, **3CX ne peut pas g√©rer les appels venant directement sur le num√©ro mobile de Miriam** tant qu'il n'est pas li√© √† un service VoIP ou SIP. 3CX est con√ßu pour intercepter et traiter les appels **via un r√©seau IP**. Les appels pass√©s via le r√©seau GSM classique (de sa carte SIM) sont en dehors du contr√¥le de 3CX, sauf si tu utilises une solution de redirection sp√©cifique.

### Solutions possibles :
1. **Portage du num√©ro vers un fournisseur SIP** : Tu pourrais envisager de **transf√©rer/porter** le num√©ro GSM actuel vers un fournisseur VoIP compatible SIP. Cela permettrait √† 3CX de g√©rer ce num√©ro comme un num√©ro principal via le dashboard, avec toutes les r√®gles que tu d√©finis dans 3CX.
2. **Redirection via op√©rateur** : Une autre solution serait de configurer une **redirection d'appel** depuis la ligne de Miriam (via son op√©rateur t√©l√©phonique) vers un **num√©ro VoIP** (fourni par un SIP Trunk), permettant √† 3CX de prendre le contr√¥le de l'appel.

En r√©sum√© :
- **Pour g√©rer les appels externes** (entrant ou sortant), un **SIP Trunk** est n√©cessaire car c'est ce qui connecte ton syst√®me 3CX au r√©seau t√©l√©phonique public.
- Si Miriam utilise son num√©ro GSM pour recevoir des appels, ces appels sont g√©r√©s par son **op√©rateur mobile** et **non par 3CX**. Le num√©ro doit √™tre converti en **num√©ro VoIP** (ou redirig√©) pour que 3CX puisse appliquer ses r√®gles d'appel. 

Cela explique pourquoi tu ne peux pas rediriger les appels entrants directement depuis son smartphone avec l'application 3CX sans SIP Trunk„Äê45‚Ä†source„Äë„Äê46‚Ä†source„Äë„Äê47‚Ä†source„Äë.

If there is even a chance, that you will add an additional PSTN line, in the future, it may be worthwhile to consider a multi-line gateway.   

If you find the need to place outgoing calls, when the PSTN line is engaged, you could add a SIP provider, just for outgoing. Many will allow you to send the same caller ID used by your your PSTN line so people will call back, on your existing line. This can usually be done with no monthly charge, just a very low cost for the time used. In the future, you might also consider porting over the PSTN number, to that same provider, once you become comfortable with VoIP.

metadata.title: 3CX Phone System: Pricing, Top Features, Pros & Cons
metadata.text:
The 3CX Enterprise plan includes all Professional plan features plus:

  * Voice Calling Features: Skills-based routing, pause-resume call recording, inbuilt failover, custom IP phone logo, standby license
  * Video Conferencing Features: Up to 250 video meeting participants
  * Third-Party Integrations: Microsoft Teams

## 3CX Phone System Top Features

3CX offers an impressive array of features across all plans, including voice and video calling, business SMS, website chat, team collaboration tools, and analytics. Below, we provide a quick overview of 3CX‚Äôs best features, which include call routing, ring groups, real-time reports, call flow design, and more.

### Call Switchboard

All paid 3CX plans include the call switchboard feature, which is an end-user dashboard for streamlined, one-click call management.

[Image 4: 3cx switchboard]

The switchboard displays real-time agent status, enables drag-and-drop call transfers (warm/blind), and lets users upgrade voice calls to an audio conference or video call. Within the switchboard, users can also send chat or text messages, record calls, leave voicemails, park calls, and place callers on hold.

Different switchboard views are available for agents, receptionists, admins, and managers.¬† Only managers have access to call monitoring, call barge, and call whisper capabilities, as well as live call queue monitoring via 3CX wallboards.

### Basic Voice Calling Features

[Image 5: 3cx business hour routing]

3CX offers numerous voice calling and call management features, including:

  * Interactive Voice Response (IVR): All paid 3CX plans include auto attendants and „Äê15‚Ä†multi-level IVR„Äë. Admins can upload pre-recorded call menus to direct inbound calls without involving a live agent. Each IVR menu can have up to 10 sub-menus that route callers to the best available call queue , extension, agent, or ring group.
  * Call Routing and Business Hour Rules: Paid 3CX plans include custom business hour routing rules that follow preset call paths during business hours, but forward calls to external numbers or voicemail boxes after office hours. The Small Business plan includes simultaneous call blasting and numerous „Äê44‚Ä†call routing strategies„Äë, including round robin, list-based, random, most idle, fewest answered calls, and lowest talk time routing. Custom routing strategies are also available. „Äê45‚Ä†Skills-based routing„Äë is limited to the Professional and Enterprise plans.
  * Ring Groups and Call Queues: Admins can create ring groups of multiple agents with similar skill sets, schedules, or other criteria. Calls can be routed to these ring groups instead of individual agents, increasing the likelihood of an answer. Callers are sent to wait in customizable call queues if no agents are available. Enterprise users can access advanced call queue features like built-in post-call wrap-up time, call queue maximums, call queue email notifications, and priority queues.
  * Call Flow Designer: Enterprise and Professional 3CX plans include the self-managed call flow designer for more advanced IVR and call distribution. Users can also collect customer payments via phone, customize outbound dialing rules, access power dialing, specifically the amount of time between outbound calls, and create customer surveys.
  * Voicemail: All 3CX plans include voicemail messaging with a custom greeting, voicemail-to-email, real-time voicemail push notifications, and one-click callbacks. Voicemail transcription is available only to Professional and Enterprise users.
  * Call Recording: All 3CX paid plans include manual (on-demand) call recording, with pause-resume recording restricted to Enterprise plan holders. Searchable local and cloud recording storage is included. Recording transcription is only available via a paid OpenAI integration, which users must configure themselves.
  * Customer Callback: Instead of requiring customers to wait on hold, admins can enable „Äê46‚Ä†customer callbacks„Äë to let customers schedule a time to receive a callback from an available agent.

### Business Messaging

3CX provides excellent business messaging features, enabling internal and external communication via live website chat, Facebook Messenger, WhatsApp, SMS, and instant team chat messaging.

[Image 6: 3cx website chat]

All messaging interactions, regardless of channel, are streamlined into a single inbox to avoid communication silos, with icons to identify the current messaging channel.

Agents can chat with website visitors to make product recommendations, provide customer support, and increase conversions. Admins can design chat queues to connect customers to the best available agent and create automatic message response templates with custom triggers. Team members can transfer live chats, share files and images with customers, mark chats as resolved, view chat interaction history, and create contacts from chat messages.

While agents can access individual and group team chat messaging and file sharing, 3CX lacks advanced team chat features like message threading, replies, and user mentions.

### Video Conferencing

All 3CX plans include unlimited HD video conferencing for desktop and mobile devices alongside in-meeting collaboration tools. The Free and Small Business plans limit meeting participants to 25, the Professional plan allows for 100 participants, and the Enterprise plan has a 250-participant cap.

[Image 7: 3cx video calling]

3CX video conferencing is browser-based, doesn‚Äôt store personal data, and doesn‚Äôt require users to download an app or create an account to join a video call. Meetings can be scheduled or on-demand, and hosts can share meeting links via a link, chat, email, WhatsApp, or QR code. Video conferences can be livestreamed to YouTube or screencast to Chromecast-enabled devices. Meeting lengths are unlimited, with up to 16 simultaneous screens and 50 simultaneous audio-only screens.

Personalized 3CX meeting links can be added to a business website, email signature, or social media account to enable instant video meetings with customers and other external users. Users can run audio and video tests before a meeting, blur their backgrounds, set meeting layouts, enable echo cancellation, and adjust participant video and audio controls.

In-meeting collaboration features include:

  * Team chat with Q&A
  * Screen sharing and remote control
  * File and PDF sharing and annotations
  * Virtual hand-raising, and polls
  * Whiteboards with drawing tools and templates

### Reporting and Analytics

All 3CX plans come with basic call logs and chat reports, but more advanced historical and live analytics are restricted to paid plans.

3CX lets managers review chat queue volumes, chat abandonment rate, chat channel popularity (website chat, SMS, Facebook, WhatsApp), and the number of chats individual agents handled over a custom date range. Users can integrate Google Analytics for more advanced chat and website interaction monitoring.

[Image 8: 3cx wallboards]

Live call center monitoring is available via the 3CX wallboard, shown in the above image. Users can review real-time call queue statistics, average wait a

If there is even a chance, that you will add an additional PSTN line, in the future, it may be worthwhile to consider a multi-line gateway.   

If you find the need to place outgoing calls, when the PSTN line is engaged, you could add a SIP provider, just for outgoing. Many will allow you to send the same caller ID used by your your PSTN line so people will call back, on your existing line. This can usually be done with no monthly charge, just a very low cost for the time used. In the future, you might also consider porting over the PSTN number, to that same provider, once you become comfortable with VoIP.

content_references.title: 3CX Phone System: Pricing, Top Features, Pros & Cons
content_references.snippet:
The 3CX Enterprise plan includes all Professional plan features plus:

  * Voice Calling Features: Skills-based routing, pause-resume call recording, inbuilt failover, custom IP phone logo, standby license
  * Video Conferencing Features: Up to 250 video meeting participants
  * Third-Party Integrations: Microsoft Teams

## 3CX Phone System Top Features

3CX offers an impressive array of features across all plans, including voice and video calling, business SMS, website chat, team collaboration tools, and analytics. Below, we provide a quick overview of 3CX‚Äôs best features, which include call routing, ring groups, real-time reports, call flow design, and more.

### Call Switchboard

All paid 3CX plans include the call switchboard feature, which is an end-user dashboard for streamlined, one-click call management.

[Image 4: 3cx switchboard]

The switchboard displays real-time agent status, enables drag-and-drop call transfers (warm/blind), and lets users upgrade voice calls to an audio conference or video call. Within the switchboard, users can also send chat or text messages, record calls, leave voicemails, park calls, and place callers on hold.

Different switchboard views are available for agents, receptionists, admins, and managers.¬† Only managers have access to call monitoring, call barge, and call whisper capabilities, as well as live call queue monitoring via 3CX wallboards.

### Basic Voice Calling Features

[Image 5: 3cx business hour routing]

3CX offers numerous voice calling and call management features, including:

  * Interactive Voice Response (IVR): All paid 3CX plans include auto attendants and „Äê15‚Ä†multi-level IVR„Äë. Admins can upload pre-recorded call menus to direct inbound calls without involving a live agent. Each IVR menu can have up to 10 sub-menus that route callers to the best available call queue , extension, agent, or ring group.
  * Call Routing and Business Hour Rules: Paid 3CX plans include custom business hour routing rules that follow preset call paths during business hours, but forward calls to external numbers or voicemail boxes after office hours. The Small Business plan includes simultaneous call blasting and numerous „Äê44‚Ä†call routing strategies„Äë, including round robin, list-based, random, most idle, fewest answered calls, and lowest talk time routing. Custom routing strategies are also available. „Äê45‚Ä†Skills-based routing„Äë is limited to the Professional and Enterprise plans.
  * Ring Groups and Call Queues: Admins can create ring groups of multiple agents with similar skill sets, schedules, or other criteria. Calls can be routed to these ring groups instead of individual agents, increasing the likelihood of an answer. Callers are sent to wait in customizable call queues if no agents are available. Enterprise users can access advanced call queue features like built-in post-call wrap-up time, call queue maximums, call queue email notifications, and priority queues.
  * Call Flow Designer: Enterprise and Professional 3CX plans include the self-managed call flow designer for more advanced IVR and call distribution. Users can also collect customer payments via phone, customize outbound dialing rules, access power dialing, specifically the amount of time between outbound calls, and create customer surveys.
  * Voicemail: All 3CX plans include voicemail messaging with a custom greeting, voicemail-to-email, real-time voicemail push notifications, and one-click callbacks. Voicemail transcription is available only to Professional and Enterprise users.
  * Call Recording: All 3CX paid plans include manual (on-demand) call recording, with pause-resume recording restricted to Enterprise plan holders. Searchable local and cloud recording storage is included. Recording transcription is only available via a paid OpenAI integration, which users must configure themselves.
  * Customer Callback: Instead of requiring customers to wait on hold, admins can enable „Äê46‚Ä†customer callbacks„Äë to let customers schedule a time to receive a callback from an available agent.

### Business Messaging

3CX provides excellent business messaging features, enabling internal and external communication via live website chat, Facebook Messenger, WhatsApp, SMS, and instant team chat messaging.

[Image 6: 3cx website chat]

All messaging interactions, regardless of channel, are streamlined into a single inbox to avoid communication silos, with icons to identify the current messaging channel.

Agents can chat with website visitors to make product recommendations, provide customer support, and increase conversions. Admins can design chat queues to connect customers to the best available agent and create automatic message response templates with custom triggers. Team members can transfer live chats, share files and images with customers, mark chats as resolved, view chat interaction history, and create contacts from chat messages.

While agents can access individual and group team chat messaging and file sharing, 3CX lacks advanced team chat features like message threading, replies, and user mentions.

### Video Conferencing

All 3CX plans include unlimited HD video conferencing for desktop and mobile devices alongside in-meeting collaboration tools. The Free and Small Business plans limit meeting participants to 25, the Professional plan allows for 100 participants, and the Enterprise plan has a 250-participant cap.

[Image 7: 3cx video calling]

3CX video conferencing is browser-based, doesn‚Äôt store personal data, and doesn‚Äôt require users to download an app or create an account to join a video call. Meetings can be scheduled or on-demand, and hosts can share meeting links via a link, chat, email, WhatsApp, or QR code. Video conferences can be livestreamed to YouTube or screencast to Chromecast-enabled devices. Meeting lengths are unlimited, with up to 16 simultaneous screens and 50 simultaneous audio-only screens.

Personalized 3CX meeting links can be added to a business website, email signature, or social media account to enable instant video meetings with customers and other external users. Users can run audio and video tests before a meeting, blur their backgrounds, set meeting layouts, enable echo cancellation, and adjust participant video and audio controls.

In-meeting collaboration features include:

  * Team chat with Q&A
  * Screen sharing and remote control
  * File and PDF sharing and annotations
  * Virtual hand-raising, and polls
  * Whiteboards with drawing tools and templates

### Reporting and Analytics

All 3CX plans come with basic call logs and chat reports, but more advanced historical and live analytics are restricted to paid plans.

3CX lets managers review chat queue volumes, chat abandonment rate, chat channel popularity (website chat, SMS, Facebook, WhatsApp), and the number of chats individual agents handled over a custom date range. Users can integrate Google Analytics for more advanced chat and website interaction monitoring.

[Image 8: 3cx wallboards]

Live call center monitoring is available via the 3CX wallboard, shown in the above image. Users can review real-time call queue statistics, average wait a

Choosing the right SIP trunking pricing model requires careful consideration of various factors: 1. Call Volume and Patterns. Analyze your historical call data to understand your average and peak call volumes. If your call patterns are predictable and stable, per-channel pricing might be suitable.

1: Log in to Control Hub https://admin.webex.com, go to Services > Calling > Call Routing.. 2: Select Add Trunk.. 3: Select a Location from the drop-down list.. 4: Enter a Name for the trunk.. 5: Select Registering from the Trunk Type drop-down list.. 6: Dual Identity Support setting impacts the handling of the From header and P-Asserted-Identity (PAI) header when sending an initial SIP INVITE ...

Advanced calling options. ## Manage your business calls as you wish

[Image 0] 

Simultaneous calls

Your team can make and receive unlimited calls* through a landline number, all while having personal numbers.

## The smart system for handling your business calls

#### With Bizz Call Connect, you won't miss any call

  * From your employees' landlines and mobile devices
  * Access all the functionalities of a telephone exchange
  * Easy management through a web portal or mobile app
  * Flexibility: add or remove users very easily

* * *

  * Choose between several payment methods:  
[Image 3: Visa] [Image 4: Mastercard] [Image 5: Bancontact] [Image 6: Maestro]

* * *

„Äê30‚Ä†Do you need the aftersale service?„Äë

#### How does Bizz Call Connect work?

 See more See less

#### How does Bizz Call Connect work?

An example: Peter and Mary are architects and share the same office.

They have a general number which they give out to their customers and use in their communication (business card, website, advertising, etc.). If a customer dials this number, the call will simultaneously arrive on both Peter and Mary‚Äôs landline. If they are on a construction site, the call will be diverted to their mobile phone.

On the construction site when Mary and Peter call a customer from their mobile, it's the landline number that will be displayed. In this way, their mobile phone numbers remain private.

On Tuesdays, Mary is always in the office.

To avoid disturbing Peter, all calls arrive on Mary's landline phone only.

Outside office hours, a welcome message is played back to customers. They can leave any messages on an answering machine.

[Image 7]

Bizz Call Connect

As from ‚Ç¨25 /month + free installation

„Äê31‚Ä†Request a quote„Äë 

## How does the installation work?

### Free installation

A technician will call in at no charge to install the Bizz Call Connect solution and the associated equipment. He will take care of the basic setup and help you familiarize with the phones, the app and the portal.

[Image 8] 

#### Limit your investments and rent IP phones

You don't have to invest in hardware. You can rent IP phones from Proximus.

„Äê32‚Ä† Discover the phones Opens a new window „Äë 

 Conditions 

  * „Äê33‚Ä† General conditions „Äë 
  * „Äê34‚Ä† Promotion conditions „Äë 

The „Äê35‚Ä†Terms and Conditions„Äë and „Äê36‚Ä†Pricelist & tariffs„Äë apply.

A Proximus VDSL2 Internet line is required to use Bizz Call Connect.  
*Unlimited national calls with Business Flex : *Unlimited national calls to landline numbers and 1,000 minutes per month to mobile numbers, valid from one fixed number.  
If you call for more than 1,000 minutes, you pay a special rate. Calls 24/7, except to special numbers (voting, 0900, etc.).  
*Unlimited international calls: from your landline, 1,000 minutes for calling landline and mobile numbers in 37 countries (Andorra, Bulgaria, Canada, Cyprus, Denmark, Germany, Estonia, Faroe Islands, Finland, France, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Croatia, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Monaco, Netherlands, Norway, Austria, Poland, Portugal, Romania, San Marino, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Czech Republic, United Kingdom, United States, Sweden, and Switzerland). Only to landline numbers in Morocco and Turkey. If you exceed the 1,000 minutes or call other countries, you pay a special rate of -50% instead of the standard rate (Classic).

If you opt for a Business Flex plan, the ¬´ Bizz Switch ¬ª product is automatically removed from your pack as all its features are included in Bizz Call Connect. When a Bizz Call Connect solution or Multi Line is added to ¬† Business Flex , the included traditional telephone line (PSTN) will be automatically replaced by an IP line. NB: some alarms are not compatible with the IP line. Please contact your vendor for more information.

Promo Free installation (instead of ‚Ç¨ 350) valid from 01 July 2019 to 31 December 2024 for the installation and configuration costs of the licenses and for travel costs, but does not include the cost of installing options, extra indoor cabling, any specific on-site work required, and the cost of installing the lines and Internet.

* * *

### 100% secure payment

  * Choose between several payment methods:  
[Image 3: Visa] [Image 4: Mastercard] [Image 5: Bancontact] [Image 6: Maestro]
  * Possibility for (bi)-monthly invoice depending of ordered online product

* * *

„Äê30‚Ä†Do you need the aftersale service?„Äë

#### How does Bizz Call Connect work?

 See more See less

#### How does Bizz Call Connect work?

An example: Peter and Mary are architects and share the same office.

They have a general number which they give out to their customers and use in their communication (business card, website, advertising, etc.). If a customer dials this number, the call will simultaneously arrive on both Peter and Mary‚Äôs landline. If they are on a construction site, the call will be diverted to their mobile phone.

On the construction site when Mary and Peter call a customer from their mobile, it's the landline number that will be displayed. In this way, their mobile phone numbers remain private.

On Tuesdays, Mary is always in the office.

To avoid disturbing Peter, all calls arrive on Mary's landline phone only.

Outside office hours, a welcome message is played back to customers. They can leave any messages on an answering machine.

[Image 7]

Bizz Call Connect

As from ‚Ç¨25 /month + free installation

„Äê31‚Ä†Request a quote„Äë 

## How does the installation work?

### Free installation

A technician will call in at no charge to install the Bizz Call Connect solution and the associated equipment. He will take care of the basic setup and help you familiarize with the phones, the app and the portal.

[Image 8] 

#### Limit your investments and rent IP phones

You don't have to invest in hardware. You can rent IP phones from Proximus.

„Äê32‚Ä† Discover the phones Opens a new window „Äë 

 Conditions 

  * „Äê33‚Ä† General conditions „Äë 
  * „Äê34‚Ä† Promotion conditions „Äë 

The „Äê35‚Ä†Terms and Conditions„Äë and „Äê36‚Ä†Pricelist & tariffs„Äë apply.

A Proximus VDSL2 Internet line is required to use Bizz Call Connect.  
*Unlimited national calls with Business Flex : *Unlimited national calls to landline numbers and 1,000 minutes per month to mobile numbers, valid from one fixed number.  
If you call for more than 1,000 minutes, you pay a special rate. Calls 24/7, except to special numbers (voting, 0900, etc.).  
*Unlimited international calls: from your landline, 1,000 minutes for calling landline and mobile numbers in 37 countries (Andorra, Bulgaria, Canada, Cyprus, Denmark, Germany, Estonia, Faroe Islands, Finland, France, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Croatia, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Monaco, Netherlands, Norway, Austria, Poland, Portugal, Romania, San Marino, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Czech Republic, United Kingdom, United States, Sweden, and Switzerland). Only to landline numbers in Morocco and Turkey. If you exceed the 1,000 minutes or call other countries, you pay a special rate of -50% instead of the standard rate (Classic).

If you opt for a Business Flex plan, the ¬´ Bizz Switch ¬ª product is automatically removed from your pack as all its features are included in Bizz Call Connect. When a Bizz Call Connect solution or Multi Line is added to ¬† Business Flex , the included traditional telephone line (PSTN) will be automatically replaced by an IP line. NB: some alarms are not compatible with the IP line. Please contact your vendor for more information.

Promo Free installation (instead of ‚Ç¨ 350) valid from 01 July 2019 to 31 December 2024 for the installation and configuration costs of the licenses and for travel costs, but does not include the cost of installing options, extra indoor cabling, any specific on-site work required, and the cost of installing the lines and Internet.
